title: New $150m fund targets net zero “disruption” start-ups across energy, transport, recycling
summary: Pollination, a specialist investment firm, has launched a $150 million venture capital fund to support climate and nature start-ups across five emerging sectors: energy, transport, food and agriculture, carbon and nature management, and the circular economy. The fund expects to begin making investments in late 2024 and will take three to five years to allocate capital. Pollination already has a stake in Australian climate technology firms and an East Kimberley partnership with a First Nations-led clean energy, green hydrogen and green ammonia export project.
green_innovation: TRUE, The fund will support start-ups that are developing new products and processes to address climate change and nature preservation.
business_innovation: TRUE, The fund will support start-ups that are developing new products and processes that are innovative and have the potential to be scaled up to meet demand.
green_product: TRUE, The fund will support start-ups that are developing new products that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, The fund will support start-ups that are developing new processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

title: Global Solar Panel Recycling Market Analysis 2024-2034, Featuring First Solar, Sharp, Trina Solar, We Recycle Solar, Reiling and Yingli Energy Co.
summary: The solar panel recycling market is growing due to the increasing adoption of solar energy and government regulations promoting renewable energy deployment and waste management. The market is expected to reach $1.86 billion by 2034, driven by factors such as declining costs, technological advancements, and increasing environmental awareness. Key players in the market include First Solar, Inc., Sharp Corporation, and Trina Solar.
green_innovation: TRUE. The solar panel recycling market is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing the environmental impact of solar panels throughout their life cycle.
business_innovation: TRUE. The solar panel recycling market is a business innovation because it represents a new or improved business process for managing end-of-life solar panels, with the potential to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
green_product: TRUE. Solar panels are green products because they are designed to generate renewable energy, reducing reliance on fossil fuels and mitigating climate change.
green_process: TRUE. Solar panel recycling is a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, decreasing energy consumption, and limiting the release of harmful substances into the environment.

title: Global Soy-Based Chemicals Market to Reach USD 61591.8 million by 2034, Driven by Eco-Friendly Trends
summary: The global soy-based chemicals market is projected to grow significantly, driven by increasing demand for sustainable and eco-friendly alternatives to traditional petrochemicals. Soy-based chemicals are finding widespread applications across industries such as cosmetics, food, agriculture, and textiles, thanks to their biodegradability and reduced environmental impact. The market is poised for robust growth, supported by sustainability imperatives, regulatory support, and technological advancements.
green_innovation: TRUE, Soy-based chemicals are derived from renewable resources and offer a more sustainable and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional petrochemicals.
business_innovation: TRUE, Soy-based chemicals are finding new applications across various industries, such as cosmetics, food, agriculture, and textiles, indicating that they are new or improved products or processes that differ significantly from previous products or processes.
green_product: TRUE, Soy-based chemicals are derived from renewable resources, are biodegradable, and have a reduced environmental impact, meeting the criteria to be considered a green product.
green_process: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific process that meets the criteria to be considered a green process.

title: A sewage treatment plant as a source of raw materials
summary: A sewage treatment plant in Stuttgart, Germany, has developed a pilot plant that demonstrates how sewage treatment plants can contribute to climate neutrality by recovering raw materials. The biorefinery pilot plant has been operating successfully since 2023 and has shown that the process chain is effective and could be implemented in other sewage treatment plants. The project is part of the state strategy “Sustainable Bioeconomy for Baden-Württemberg”.
green_innovation: TRUE; The project is recovering raw materials from wastewater to make products such as fertilizer, hydrogen and bioplastics, which helps to reduce the production of climate-damaging gases and replace petroleum-based substances.
business_innovation: TRUE; The project has developed a new process for recovering raw materials from wastewater that could be implemented in other sewage treatment plants.
green_product: TRUE; The project is producing fertilizer, hydrogen and bioplastics from wastewater, which are all green products.
green_process: TRUE; The project has developed a new process for recovering raw materials from wastewater that reduces the production of climate-damaging gases.
company: University of Stuttgart and the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)
